did.unittitle: Alice Greenfield McGrath papers
did.abstract: Alice McGrath (1917-2009) was a political activist who first became known for her work to overturn the improper convictions of Mexican American youth in Sleepy Lagoon Trial in which the defendants were tried as a group under inhumane conditions. McGrath also supported humanitarian efforts and revolution in Nicaragua, pro bono work through the Mexican American Bar Association, and taught courses on self defense. The collection consists of trial documents, correspondence, articles, awards, photographs, and other ephemera.
did.physloc: Stored off-site. All requests to access special collections material must be made in advance using the request button located on this page.

dao.xlink:title: Alice Greenfield McGrath papers on Calisphere (28 items)

daodesc.p: Alice Greenfield McGrath papers on Calisphere (28 items)

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Open for research. All requests to access special collections materials must be made in advance using the request button located on this page.

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: CONTAINS AUDIOVISUAL AND DIGITAL MATERIALS: This collection contains both processed and unprocessed audiovisual and digital materials. Audiovisual and digital materials are not currently available for access, unless otherwise noted in a Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements note at the series and file levels. All requests to access processed audiovisual materials must be made in advance using the request button located on this page.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Property rights to the objects belong to UCLA Library Special Collections. All other rights, including copyright, are retained by the creators and their heirs. It is the responsibility of the researcher to determine who holds the copyright and pursue the copyright owner or his or her heir for permission to publish where The UC Regents do not hold the copyright.

acqinfo.head: Provenance/Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Gift of Alice McGrath, 1986; additions to collections gifted by Alice McGrath in 1990, 1995, and 2003.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Alice Greenfield McGrath papers (Collection 1490). UCLA Library Special Collections, Charles E. Young Research Library, University of California, Los Angeles.

processinfo.head: Processing Note
processinfo.p: Processed by Gloria E. Chacon in the Center for Primary Research and Training (CFPRT) with assistance from Kelley Wolfe Bachli, 2011.

Collections are processed to a variety of levels depending on the work necessary to make them usable, their perceived user interest and research value, availability of staff and resources, and competing priorities. Library Special Collections provides a standard level of preservation and access for all collections and, when time and resources permit, conducts more intensive processing. These materials have been arranged and described according to national and local standards and best practices.

We are committed to providing ethical, inclusive, and anti-racist description of the materials we steward, and to remediating existing description of our materials that contains language that may be offensive or cause harm. We invite you to submit feedback about how our collections are described, and how they could be described more accurately, by filling out the form located on our website: Report Problematic Content and Description in UCLA's library collections and archives.

bioghist.head: Biography
bioghist.p: Alice Greenfield McGrath (April 5, 1917-November 27, 2009) was a political activist who first became known for her work to overturn the improper convictions of Mexican American youth in Sleepy Lagoon Trial in which the defendants were tried as a group under inhumane conditions. McGrath also supported humanitarian efforts and revolution in Nicaragua, pro bono work through the Mexican American Bar Association, and taught courses on self defense.

Alice Greenfield McGrath was born in Calgary, Canada to a family of Russian Jewish immigrants. At the age of 5, McGrath and her family moved to Los Angeles. McGrath's experience growing up as an immigrant heavily influenced her later involvement in social activism. After graduating high school, McGrath worked several jobs including working in a candy factory and as a sales representative for Grove Press.

At the age of 24, Alice McGrath began volunteering for the defense committee of the Sleepy Lagoon Trial, now widely known for unjustly convicting an entire group of young Mexican-American youth with little evidence and many human rights violations. Several months later, she was appointed executive secretary. Though she was not directly involved in the legal work on the case, she worked tirelessly to raise awareness about the trial, coordinate efforts. Of particular note is McGrath's effort to correspond with and visit the defendants in prison. In October 1944 the committee's work paid off, and Judge Clement Nye overturned the convictions. The case then became a foundation for legal decisions nationwide concerning defendants' rights.

Alice Greenfield McGrath's direct involvement in the case led playwright Luis Valdez to contact her and buy the rights to her character. In l978, Zoot Suit, a play by Luis Valdez based on the sleepy lagoon case and the servicemen riots premiered at the Mark Taper Forum with much acclaimed success. The play is a fictionalized account of the trial. Alice McGrath becomes the central character. A film rendition of the play makes headlines in the l980s.

In 1952, she married Thomas McGrath, a poet and teacher. During this time, both came under surveillance by the FBI for their political ideologies and community activism. This investigation led to Thomas McGrath being summoned to appear before the Un-American Activities Committee.

Around 1957, Alice McGrath met Bruce Tegner, her son Daniel's self-defense instructor. Based on her son's experience, McGrath enrolled in Tegner's courses, earned various titles, and began working with Tegner to write books on self-defense. She later taught self-defense courses at various community centers and colleges around Southern California.

In addition to her career, McGrath continued to volunteer her time toward political and humanitarian efforts. She made numerous trips to Nicaragua during and after the Sandinista National Liberation Front overthrow of the Somoza government. She led clergy, physicians, lawyers, and teachers on tours through the country and helped raise money to buy medicine for Nicaraguan hospitals and Hurricane Mitch victims, her humanitarian work also continued in the United States, where she became the coordinator of the Pro Bono department of the Mexican American Bar Association.
Alice McGrath died on November 27, 2009 at the age of 92 from complications of a chronic illness.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The collection consists of trial documentation, correspondence, publicity materials, photographs, articles, books, and ephemera.

The bulk of the material in the collection relates to the Sleepy Lagoon trial and its development into a play and film. In addition, documentation and photographs from McGrath's support of the Sandinista National Liberation Front and humanitarian work in Nicaragua constitute a large portion of the collection. The collection also includes personal photographs, awards, correspondence, and documentation of a trip to China.

arrangement.head: Organization and Arrangement
arrangement.p:
Arranged in the following series:
Sleepy Lagoon trial
Sleepy Lagoon Defense Committee
Zoot-Suit media adaptations
Personal papers
Correspondence
Writings
Miscellaneous
Photographs
Magazines, books, film scripts
China trip
Nicaragua
Awards and recognitions
Government investigation files
Self-defense

relatedmaterial.head: Related Oral Histories
relatedmaterial.p: The following oral histories are available through the UCLA Library Center for Oral History Research:

Interview of Alice McGrath [oral history transcript] / James V. Mink and Gerald Nash, interviewers. UCLA Library Special Collections, Center for Oral History Research interview, 1981. Available at UCLA Library Special Collections, Charles E. Young Research Library, UCLA.

The Education of Alice McGrath [oral history transcript] / Michael Balter, interviewer. UCLA Library Special Collections, Center for Oral History Research interview, 1987. Available at UCLA Library Special Collections, Charles E. Young Research Library, UCLA.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: Sleepy Lagoon Defense Committee Records (Collection 107) . Available at the Library Special Collections, UCLA.

altformavail.head: Online Items Available
altformavail.p: Portions of this collection have been digitaized and are available online through Calisphere: McGrath (Alice G.) papers (28 items)

did.unittitle: 1. Sleepy Lagoon Trial.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains documents pertaining to the trial, correspondence between Alice McGrath and the defendants, newspaper clippings, and ephemera and correspondence pertaining to the play and film adaptations of the events.

did.unittitle: 1.1 Sleepy Lagoon Defense Committee.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This subseries focuses on all documents pertaining to the actual historical trial.

Issue also includes an article by Alice McGrath, "Longshot O'Leary Says It's Your Duty to Be Full of Fury."

did.unittitle: Recordings of Alice McGrath and Luis Valdez.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes 3 DVDs and a letter addressed to Laura D'Auri from Frank Sotomayor. Letter describes the recording on each of the three discs. Recordings include an interview of McGrath by Frank Sotomayor, McGrath lecturing on the Sleepy Lagoon case, a question and answer session with McGrath, and an interview of Luis Valdez about the Zoot Suit play and McGrath. The recordings appear to be transfers from VHS tapes, and the sound and image quality is often poor.

did.unittitle: Alice McGrath interviewd by Frank Sotomayor at her home in Ventura

did.unittitle: Alice McGrath interviewed by Luis Valdez at the El Teatro Campesino

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes DVD of interview and a discussion between Alice McGrath and Alika Spencer, the woman who plays McGrath's character in the Zoot Suit play. DVD is in plastic jewel case with a facsimile of a letter Valdez sent to McGrath in 1978. Folder also includes letter from Valdez to Laura D'Auri in 2010 and photograph of Luis, Alice, and others, circa 2007.

did.unittitle: Alice McGrath interviewed by Luis Valdez at the El Teatro Campesino

did.unittitle: 5. China trip.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Consists of ephemera, travel diary, and photographs of her trip to China.

did.unittitle: Photograph.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Taken in conjunction with Alice McGrath's English lecture on "Zoot Suit."

did.unittitle: Alice McGrath's China trip diary.
A Tourist Guide to Chungking and map.
Photographs of Alice McGrath and others in China.
Postcards, Stamps, and Letters during Alice McGrath's China trip.
Information about China.
McGrath's notebooks containing notes on China Trip.
6. Solidarity work in Nicaragua.

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: CONTAINS AUDIOVISUAL MATERIALS: This collection contains both processed and unprocessed audiovisual materials. Audiovisual materials are not currently available for access, unless otherwise noted in a Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements note at the file level. All requests to access processed audiovisual materials must be made in advance using the request button located on this page.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This series relates to McGrath's work in support of the Sandinista National Liberation Front (FLSN) and McGrath's humanitarian tours of the country. Consists of correspondence, ephemera, and photos.

did.unittitle: Nicaraguan Delegation lists.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes letter and programs of events.

did.unittitle: Center for Training in Computer Science and Systems (CAIS) -- microcomputer training project.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Also includes letters to McGrath about her donations.

did.unittitle: Correspondence and photographs.
Sandinista Constitution.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Copy of constitutional reform provided by the Nicaraguan Embassy.

did.unittitle: La Seaman Comical Newspaper and other newspaper clippings.
Memoria Ejercito de Nicaragua 1995-1997. Managua: Direccion de Relaciones Publicas y Exteriores.

Instituto Nicaraguense de Seguridad Social y Bienestar. Martirio De Los Niños De Nicaragua Bajo La Agresion De La Administracion Regan. Managua: Instituto Nicaraguense de Seguridad Social y Bienestar.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Also includes The Subversive Agent (For A Poetry of Revolutionary Activism).

did.unittitle: Torres, Sylvia. Una 'chela' con algo extra. Barrada supplement, Managua.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Note written by Alice McGrath and stuck to article indicates the article is "loaded with inaccuracies."

did.unittitle: Photographs.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Photographs picture Alice McGrath delivering supplies to a Nicaraguan children's hospital, Sergio Ramirez (Vice President from 1984-1990), Mary Addes, Xabier Gorostiaga and LASA.

did.unittitle: Photographs -- Alice McGrath with campesinos and companeros.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Many of the photographs included are laminated.

did.unittitle: Photographs -- tours.
Photographs -- American farmers with Alice McGrath (in Nicaragua).
Photographs -- murals in Managua Church that was to be painted over.
Photographs -- Alice McGrath in children's hospitals and schools.
Photographs -- people voting and FSLN supporters.
Photographs -- Alice McGrath on her 25th trip to Nicaragua.
Photographs -- Cuban veterinarians and doctors delegation.
Photographs -- American Citizens demonstrating.
Photograph -- McGrath with Daniel Nunez.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Nuñez was president of UNAG (National Farmer's and Cattleman's Association of Nicaragua).

did.unittitle: Photograph -- clergy delegation and Soviet Circus.
Photograph -- Dr. Fernando Silva and army base.
Photograph -- La Orden Decimo Aniversario for solidarity work.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes clippings and the medal McGrath received.

did.unittitle: Certificate from Frente Sandinista de la Liberacion Nacional to Alice McGrath.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Awarded to recognize McGrath's support of the Sandinistas.

did.unittitle: Photograph -- Alice McGrath with Daniel Ortega.
Cards and Postcards from Nicaragua.
Nicaraguan currency and stamp.
Commemorative day planner.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: 10th Anniversary Celebration Calendar (planner) of the triumph of the Nicaraguan Revolution from July 19, 1989 to December 30, 1990

did.unittitle: Election ephemera.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: The Electoral Process in Nicaragua: Domestic and International Influences, Electoral Law pamphlet, sample ballot.

did.unittitle: Photographs and slides.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes slides taken in Nicaragua, photos of AM with Lewites, Herty (Mayor of Managua) and other companeros, inscription from author Gioconda Bellis.

did.unittitle: Frente Sandinista de la Liberacion Nacional scarf.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This is the same scarf Alice McGrath is wearing in the photograph with Daniel Ortega

did.unittitle: 7. Awards and recognitions.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Consists of general recognitions, awards, and thank you notes. The awards and letters predominantly relate to McGrath's political activism.

did.unittitle: Thank you letters -- lectures and appearances.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This folder contains various letters from institutions where Alice McGrath served on a panel or gave a lecture. Many of these lectures were on the topic of the Sleep Lagoon trial.

did.unittitle: Sheldon, Glenn. Interview with Alice McGrath.Pittsburgh Quarterly (Winter 1991/92).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes print out of article and letter to Alice McGrath from the author.

did.unittitle: El Concilio del Condado de Ventura Tenth Annual Latino Leadership Awards.
County of Ventura Leadership Award.
Cruz Reynoso Award.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This folder contains the program for the 38th annual banquet of the Mexican American Bar Association.

did.unittitle: The Rotary Foundation of Rotary International.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Certificate recognizes Alice McGrath as a benefactor of the Rotary Foundation.

did.unittitle: Various Certificates of Recognition.
Clippings -- Alice McGrath's awards and recognitions.
University of California, Santa Cruz commencement program.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Alice McGrath gave the keynote speech at the commencement.

did.unittitle: Invitations.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Invitations are to a testimonial dinner honoring several attorneys, as well as to meet with Wallace, Henry

did.unittitle: Progressive LA Conference ephemera.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This folder includes clippings, a letter, and programming information for the conference.

did.unittitle: Ventura County Bar Association.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: McGrath served as the association's Pro Bono Program manager.

did.unittitle: Black Journalists Association of Southern Californian newsletter.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Newsletter mentions McGrath's appearance at the July meeting of the association.

did.unittitle: University of Washington's Labor Studies Department -- appreciation for Alice McGrath's donations.
Center for Constitutional Rights newsletter.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Materials in this folder relate to McGrath's donations and fundraising efforts. Also includes photographs of Alice McGrath with various members of the center.

did.unittitle: McGrath's 70th birthday celebration invitation.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes photographs with Sleepy Lagoon trial defendants.

did.unittitle: McGrath's 85th birthday celebration -- programs.
McGrath's 85th birthday celebration -- clippings.
McGrath's 85th birthday celebration -- photographs.
McGrath's 90th birthday celebration -- ephemera.
Oversized awards, certificates, and posters given to McGrath.
National Women's Political Caucus of Ventura County 2003 Women's History Calendar.
Ventura College Associate in Arts Diploma and Ventura College commencement program.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Alice McGrath served as student speaker.

did.unittitle: La Raza Faculty Association plaque
8. Government investigation files.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Both Alice McGrath and her son, Daniel Schechter, were investigated by the Federal Bureau of Investigation at different times in history. This series consists of documentation of the investigations by the F.B.I. and the Immigration and Naturalization Services.

did.unittitle: Freedom of Information Act releases -- Alice McGrath.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Official release interleaved with McGrath's personal notes.

did.unittitle: Freedom of Information Act releases -- Joseph B. Goldberg.
Correspondence between Joseph B. Goldberg, FBI Freedom of Information Branch, and Army Intelligence.
Freedom of Information Act releases -- Thomas McGrath.
Max Schechter single sheet report about his business.
9. Self-defense.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Consists of the documentation of McGrath's career in teaching, writing about, and demonstrating self-defense techniques. Series includes photographs, correspondence, and articles.

did.unittitle: Clippings about Alice McGrath's writings and courses on self-defense.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Newspaper articles and clippings (from theLA Times andChicago Tribune) about McGrath's self-defense courses, "How to Become a Martial Arts Book Expert Without Hitting Anybody" by McGrath, "Self-Defense for Cowards" by Alice McGrath, letters about course

did.unittitle: California Community College's certificate of special limited services credential.
Descriptions and brochures for defense classes.
Correspondence and descriptions for defense classes (folder 1 of 2).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Letters to McGrath about her self-defense course from schools, Journal of physical education and recreation, California Physical Ed. Workshop booklet, Self Defense & Assault Prevention for Girls and Women seminar conducted by McGrath.

did.unittitle: Correspondence and descriptions for defense classes (folder 2 of 2).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Letters to McGrath about her self-defense course from schools, Journal of physical education and recreation, California Physical Ed. Workshop booklet, Self Defense & Assault Prevention for Girls and Women seminar conducted by McGrath.

did.unittitle: McGrath, Alice and Chris Jenkyns. Better Part of Valor. The Sunday Telegraph, page 5.
McGrath, Alice. How to Become a Martial Arts Book Expert without Hitting Anybody. Top of the News 34, no. 4 (Summer 1978):331-338.
Tegner, Bruce and Alice McGrath.The Survival Book. New York: Bantam Books, 1983.
Photographs -- examples of self-defense techniques.
McGrath, Alice.Self-Defense for Cowards. Hollywood, CA: Thor Publications Co., 1961.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Drawings by Chris Jenkyns. One copy has an inscription by Stan Freberg and Chris Jenkyns.

did.unittitle: Tegner, Bruce and Alice McGrath.Self-Defense and Assault Prevention for Girls and Women. Hollywood, CA: Thor Publications Co., 1986.
10. Memorial ephemera.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Consists of letters, cards, sound and video recordings, and other materials received by Laura D'Auri or created for McGrath's memorial ceremony.

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: CONTAINS UNPROCESSED DIGITAL AND AUDIOVISUAL MATERIALS: Digital and audiovisual materials are not currently available for access and will require further processing and assessment. If you have questions about this material please email spec-coll@library.ucla.edu.

did.unittitle: Obituaries.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes copies of the obituaries run in the Los Angeles Times, the Ventura Star, and the Los Angeles Daily Journal.

did.unittitle: List of invitees to McGrath's memorial ceremony.
Memorial announcements.
Funeral guest book.
Condolence correspondence.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Included in this folder are letters of condolence written to Laura D'Auri, McGrath's daughter. Letters included from Lee Ann Meyer, John F. Terzano (The Justice Project), James Gregory (Harry Bridges Center for Labor Studies), Fernando Gamboa, Gus and Lamont Yeakey and others.

did.unittitle: Slide show shown at memorial.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Consists of 1 DVD and 2 CDs, all of which have some variation of a slide show featuring pictures of Alice McGrath at various points in her life. The slide shows consist of 34 images, captions and music.

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: CONTAINS UNPROCESSED AUDIOVISUAL MATERIALS: Audiovisual materials are not currently available for access and will require further processing and assessment. If you have questions about this material please email spec-coll@library.ucla.edu.

did.unittitle: DVD recorded at memorial.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Folder includes 2 DVDs: a regular version and an HD version. Speakers include: Steve Stone, Arthur Gilbert, Steve Perrin, Greg Totten, Kevi Brannelly, Tom Crossure, Holly Olsen (McGrath's niece), Josie Saldano, and others.

scopecontent.p: Includes 1 DVD with scanned images that were used in the slide show presentation.

did.unittitle: Memorial album.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Album containing remembrances of Alice McGrath. Authors include: Martin Hird, Arthur Gilbert, Greg Totten, Amanda Irma Perez, and Rene Rodriguez.
